turns.speaker: WINTERS
turns.text: Glass, sorry about Pooch, he was a good man. We don't have time to give you a break right now, we're going ahead and-

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: My God, you're going to use her, aren't you?

turns.speaker: WINTERS
turns.text: Glass, you're to stand by with your team.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: I promised her she'd be safe.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: It won't work, he'll know it's a trap...

turns.speaker: WINTERS
turns.text: Reilly, you're done for now. What the hell were you thinking directing the Bomb Squad Team into hot pursuit. They had no business-

turns.speaker: WINTERS
turns.text: You've been at the center of two suspect fatalities and two Police Officer fatalities. I'll need your badge and your weapon.

turns.speaker: WINTERS
turns.text: Reilly, what the hell are you-?

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: Fire me later. Close in and we got the bastard.

turns.speaker: WINTERS
turns.text: Pull back. You're only an observer.

turns.speaker: WINTERS
turns.text: Reilly, what's happening? Reilly! Reilly! Do not engage. We're five minutes-

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: We'll keep him pinned in, you guys hurry up!

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: What?  I may lose it again? But I haven't found it yet! I'm sorry. Goodbye!  Yes?

turns.speaker: BOLSHEVIK
turns.text: So you lost a handbag, madame?

turns.speaker: BOLSHEVIK
turns.text: And it had diamonds in the back.

turns.speaker: BOLSHEVIK
turns.text: No!  But let me tell you--any woman who spends a fortune in times like these for a handbag--phooey, phooey, phooey!

turns.speaker: BUTLER
turns.text: M'sieu Laval, Madame would like to talk to Mademoiselle Gautier for a moment.

turns.speaker: BUTLER
turns.text: Pardon me, m'sieu. Madame Colet would like to see you in the living room.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: At once, Jacques.  We'll continue later.

turns.speaker: BUTLER
turns.text: M'sieu Laval, M'sieu Filiba would like very much to see you.

turns.speaker: BUTLER
turns.text: on staircase; from Gaston's point of view. He stops.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Madame has changed her mind. She'll be down in a minute.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Tell M'sieu Giron I can't see him now. Impossible!  And, Jacques. Dismiss the car! Madame is not going.

turns.speaker: CLOSE SHOT  GASTON
turns.text: still studying the vase. Mariette appears. He turns to her.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: Is this what you mean, M'sieu Laval?

turns.speaker: CLOSE SHOT  GASTON
turns.text: in doorway. He bows, returns into office; door shuts.

turns.speaker: CLOSE SHOT  GASTON
turns.text: A man in love, completely shaken. He sits on bed, thinks, then takes telephone slowly, decisively.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: With the compliments of Colet and Company!

turns.speaker: CLOSE SHOT  GASTON
turns.text: He bows, goes. Door shuts behind him.

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: The representative of the police wants to know how much money you had, M'sieu Filiba.

turns.speaker: FRANÇOIS
turns.text: I had exactly twenty thousand lire. I had just cashed a traveler's check and put it in my wallet.

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: Why did you let this man in, M'sieu Filiba?

turns.speaker: FRANÇOIS
turns.text: Well, he knocked at the door. You see, I was expecting two--uh--two business associates.

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: And then what happened, M'sieu Filiba?

turns.speaker: FRANÇOIS
turns.text: I said, "Come in." And there he was. A fine-looking man with a moustache and long sideburns. He said, "Good evening. I'm the doctor." I said, "Doctor?" He said, "Yes, the doctor. I came to see about your tonsils."

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: The representative of the police wants to know if there is anything wrong with your tonsils.

turns.speaker: FRANÇOIS
turns.text: That's just what I tried to tell him. Well, one word led to another. He really was a very charming fellow. So we talked for about ten minutes.

turns.speaker: FRANÇOIS
turns.text: So I said to myself, "All right, if he wants to look at them, let him look at them. No harm in that." And then he said, "Say ah." And then I said, "Ah." And that's all I remember ... And when I woke up, I still had my tonsils, but my pocketbook was gone.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Pardon me, m'sieu, but I have the feeling we have met somewhere before.

turns.speaker: FRANÇOIS
turns.text: I'm sorry, but I don't seem to recall the occasion. No, I'm afraid ...

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Well--then it must be my mistake.  I beg your pardon.

turns.speaker: FRANÇOIS
turns.text: You see--  No, no! And <u>yet</u>--  <u>Did</u> I--did--now <u>where</u> could we have--

turns.speaker: FRANÇOIS
turns.text: I wanted to say goodbye to you.

turns.speaker: FRANÇOIS
turns.text: But before I say goodbye I want to ask you one question: Have you ever been in Venice?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: No ...  Have <u>you</u> ever been in Vienna?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Let me tell you, Venice <u>can't</u> <u>compare</u> with Constantinople.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: I don't care <u>what</u> you say! In Constantinople at least you have streets, sultans, pashas--

turns.speaker: MAJOR
turns.text: Good morning.  I'd-I'd-I'd like to look at some cuff links.

turns.speaker: MAJOR
turns.text: Now see here, my good man. I've had just about enough of your insulting remarks!

turns.speaker: MAJOR
turns.text: No doubt about it--it's that secretary.

turns.speaker: FRANÇOIS
turns.text: Funny, the kind of men women fall for.

turns.speaker: MAJOR
turns.text: You know, I'm not the marrying type. I like to take my fun and leave it.

turns.speaker: FRANÇOIS
turns.text: He's really not a bad fellow.

turns.speaker: FRANÇOIS
turns.text: Insignificant ... He's a secretary, always <u>was</u> a secretary, always <u>will</u> be.

turns.speaker: MAJOR
turns.text: Funny--the first time I saw him I thought he was a doctor!

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: Yes, sir?  What shall we start with, Baron?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Oh, yes ... Well, that's not so easy.  Beginnings are always difficult.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: If Casanova suddenly ... turned out to be Romeo ... having supper with Juliet--who might become Cleopatra ... How would you start?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: It must be the most marvelous supper. We may not eat it, but it must be marvelous.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: I want to see that moon in the champagne.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: I don't want to see you at all!

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: No, Baron!  I beg your pardon.

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: But please, Baron. We're not supposed to breathe a word of it. You won't tell anybody I told you?

turns.speaker: GIRON
turns.text: M'sieu Laval, there are several things I've wanted to ask you for quite a while. I understand you are from Marseilles.

turns.speaker: GIRON
turns.text: You must be related to the Lavals of Marseilles.

turns.speaker: GIRON
turns.text: I hope you find the figures correct.

turns.speaker: GIRON
turns.text: M'sieu Laval, I have enjoyed the confidence of this family--

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: For more than forty years. So Madame told me.

turns.speaker: GIRON
turns.text: And I have known the Lavals of Marseilles for more than thirty years.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: And you, M'sieu Giron, seem to be disturbing my examination of <u>this</u> <u>report</u>.

turns.speaker: GIRON
turns.text: Examination! M'sieu Laval, what are you insinuating? I have enjoyed the confidence of this family for more than forty years. How long have you enjoyed Madame's confidence? Three weeks, I believe.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Well, that's fine. Then you are not insinuating that I am avoiding questions. And I am not insinuating that you won't let me examine this report.

turns.speaker: GIRON
turns.text: I was only asking if you are related to the Lavals of Marseilles.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: And I was only asking you if you would let me examine your report without interruption.

turns.speaker: GIRON
turns.text: I don't see why any man should get excited when he is asked about his hometown.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: And I don't see any reason for any man getting nervous when somebody checks over the figures of his report.

turns.speaker: GIRON
turns.text: Are you insinuating that this is not an honest report?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: I am only insinuating that you are nervous.

turns.speaker: GIRON
turns.text: Nervous! Why should I be nervous?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: I'm very sorry, but this is no time, M'sieu Giron--

turns.speaker: GIRON
turns.text: Right now! It's very important, M'sieu Laval.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: It may be important to you, M'sieu Giron--

turns.speaker: GIRON
turns.text: And you will be out by tomorrow morning.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: You have enjoyed the confidence of this family for more than forty years. You must be a man of about-- about sixty-five.  Let's see--  You will be exactly eighty-seven when you come out of prison.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: You say I am a crook.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Then why didn't you call the police? Why <u>don't</u> you call the police?  I'll tell you why--you crook, you.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: You see, the bag has just been found, and the reaction of relief from her former excitement and strain is just a little too much for her. It's not very serious, but just the same we'd better not take any chances.

turns.speaker: MAJOR
turns.text: No, no, no! I disagree with you absolutely. That's the trouble with you artillery men.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: The Marquis de la Tours. He was in the lobby. But I don't think he saw me. I'm positive he didn't. Thank heaven! ... But when I came up here, right out in the hall there was King Boris of Alconia!

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: The tennis player. He saw me. He bowed. What could I do? I nodded.  Baron, I shouldn't have come!

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: But you came. And you must forget everything--  except that you are here, Countess.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Do you know the Marquis de la Tours?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: You'd better not. He's really very dull. But anyhow, when the king tells the marquis he saw me, the marquis will tell the marchesa. And the marchesa is the best friend of the Duchess of Chambro. And <u>she</u> will phone the Princess de Costa. The princess doesn't like me--but I don't care!

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: But she talks a lot. And before this night is over, all Venice will know it. And tomorrow it will be Grand Canal gossip! ... Oh!

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Don't stop. Keep right on complaining. It's beautiful.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: You know, when I first saw you, I thought you were an American.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Someone from another world--so entirely different. One gets so tired of one's own class--princes and counts and dukes and kings--ah! And everybody talking shop--always trying to sell jewelry ... And then I heard your name and found you were just one of us.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: That's hotel life. In one room a man loses his wallet  and in another room a man loses-- his head.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Please.  When I came here it was for a little adventure--a little game which you play tonight and forget tomorrow. But something has changed me--and it isn't the champagne.  The whole thing is new to me. Very new. I've got a confession to make to you.  Baron, you are a crook.  You robbed the gentleman in two fifty-three, five, seven, and nine.  May I have the salt?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: You're very welcome.  Countess, believe me, before you left this room I would have told you everything ... And let me say this with love in my heart-- Countess, you are a thief.  The wallet of the gentleman in two fifty-three, five, seven, and nine is in your possession. I knew it very well when you took it out of my pocket.  In fact, you tickled me.  But your embrace was so sweet ...

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: I'm crazy about you.  By the way, your pin.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Not at all, Countess ... There's one very good stone in it.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Darling!  Now tell me--tell me all about yourself. Who are you?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: You remember the man who walked into the Bank of Constantinople and walked out <u>with</u> the Bank of Constantinople?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: I always liked him. Especially last year in Munich ...

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Last year? It can't be that long.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Yes! Don't you remember the day you took that Chinese vase from the Royal Palace  and made it into a lamp for my night table?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Darling, then let's be honest and return it to the lady.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: And take the twenty thousand francs ...

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: And tomorrow is the fifteenth. And the day after tomorrow--

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: We'll go to Venice, to the same hotel!

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: And we'll celebrate the second anniversary of the day we didn't get married!

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: --the other half, contrary to custom, shall be delivered in cash into Madame's personal custody.  Darling, that means that on the second of June we'll have eight hundred and fifty thousand francs.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: And her <u>jewelry</u> is worth a fortune!

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: No jewelry! Hands off jewelry! If we're broke--all right. I might pick up a million-franc necklace. But in times like <u>these</u> when we're doing a <u>cash</u> <u>business</u>--why take a chance on jewelry?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: You! And she's willing to pay as high as fifty francs!

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Did you ever take a good look at her--uh--

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Beautiful. And what of it?  Let me tell you something: so far as I'm concerned, her whole sex appeal is in that safe!

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Gaston. Let's open it--right now! Let's get away from here!  I don't like this place!

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Oh, no, darling. There's <u>more</u> sex appeal coming on the first of the month.  It's only ten days ...  Eight hundred and fifty thousand francs.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Darling, remember you're Gaston Monescu. You're a crook. I want you as a crook. I love you as a crook. I worship you as a crook. Steal, swindle, rob--but don't become one of those useless, good-for-nothing gigolos!

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Yes--Filiba! Venice--Grand Hotel-- room two fifty-three--

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Éysée seven, eight, nine, two.  We have to clear out.  Railroad station? Ticket office, please.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: No--not yet--but--  Two tickets to Berlin--first class and sleeper--night train ... Right ... Right ... Leave them in the name of--Don Ignacio Fernandez ... Right ... Thank you.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: At twelve twenty. I know.  Lyons two, four, seven, one.  Two more days and we'd have seven hundred and fifty thousand francs more!

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Well, we'll have to take what's here. A bird in hand is worth two in jail.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Hello ... Is this the Spanish consulate? This is Doña Ignacio Fernandez.  My husband and I are leaving tonight for Berlin ... Is it too late to get a visa this afternoon ... ? Thank you, thank you.  How long will it take you?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: I don't know. Fortunately, she has a dinner engagement tonight. I'll meet you at the station--midnight.  Hello ... Yes? What? ... You found a handbag? Well, you're three weeks too late!

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Well, see you at the Berlin Express.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: By the way, how is your German?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Are you insane? You've to get out of here at once! She may come back any minute.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: You <u>have</u> to get out of here!

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: That's what I'm here for--to get out! I want to get away from here, from you--as fast as I can and as far as a hundred thousand francs will take me.  Sixty-five, ninety-four--

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Thirty-five to the left--sixty- three, eight ... I wouldn't fall for another man if he were the biggest crook on earth ... Seventy-six, eighty-four, fifty-five--  What has she got that I haven't got?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Lily, you must listen to me.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Shut up! Don't make up any stories!

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Don't you dare lie to me!  I know you love me.  Well, why don't you say something? Come on--be brilliant. Talk yourself out of it--bluff yourself in!  Shut up, you liar, you!  That's what I want!  This is real! Money! Cash!

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Leave me alone! You were willing to sacrifice a hundred thousand francs for her.  Well--  she's worth it! [ You were willing to pay a hundred and twenty-five thousand for a <u>handbag</u>. You can pay a <u>hundred</u> thousand for him!]

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Will you be good enough to look at this bag, madame?

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: That's it! Yes, that's it! ... Jacques!

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: You know the main staircase in the opera?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Then you go to the left. There's a landing.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Then you go into the foyer.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: And as you leave the foyer, there is a little niche.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: And in that niche, there is a statue of Venus.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Neither do I.  That's where I found it.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: I don't know how I could have lost it there.  I was nowhere near that niche.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Oh ... That's strange. Maybe--are you sure this is your bag?

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: Of course it is! Are you doubting me?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Not in the least, madame. But you see, it's a very expensive bag--one has to be careful.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: And I am M'sieu Laval--if you will allow me to introduce myself.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: Well--how do you do, M'sieu Laval?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: One purse--  empty. One vanity case--

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: But really, m'sieu, this isn't necessary.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Please, Madame Colet, I believe in doing things correctly. Shall we continue?  Two hairpins, one cigarette lighter, one box of real matches, and-- Oh, yes, this letter from Major--

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: You needn't be embarrassed, madame. A lady as charming as you would, and <u>should</u>, get love letters.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: But one suggestion, madame.  Not the major.  I don't  mind his grammatical mistakes. I'll overlook his bad punctuation. But the letter has no mystery--no bouquet--no ...  And one lipstick ...  Scarlet number four.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: With your skin, I prefer crimson.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: No, no, no!  I disagree with you completely! I tried it once--

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: What shade of powder do you use?

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: Do you realize I have light eyes?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: But, Madame Colet, that's a matter of eye shadow. I can straighten that out in two seconds.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: Goodbye, M'sieu La-- Oh, yes ... This is a rather delicate matter and I don't want to ... You see, if you read my advertisement carefully, you must have noticed that there was ...

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: In other words, madame, it embarrasses you to offer me the twenty thousand francs reward.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Don't be embarrassed, madame. I'll take it. I need the money. I wish I were in a position to ignore the whole matter. But you know, madame, the stock market, bank crash ... To make a long story short--a member of the nouveaux poor.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: Then I'm glad I lost the bag! I'll write you the check immediately.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Do you know my first name?

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: No. What is it? Tell me.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: And do you know what I'd like to have you do with that check?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Early eighteenth century. I should say around--seventeen thirty.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: It <u>is</u> beautiful. But I got a little tired of sleeping in antiques, so I gave it to my secretary.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: This used to be my secretary's room.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: I see.  She must have been very happy here.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: Too happy. That's why I discharged her.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Isn't that wonderful!  You see, madame--

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: But, madame, you keep a hundred thousand francs--in your safe--at <u>home</u>?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: No! Not enough!  In times like these, when everything is uncertain, every conservative person should have a substantial part of his fortune within arm's reach.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Madame Colet, I think you deserve a scolding. First, you lose your bag--

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Then you use the wrong lipstick--

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: Tell me, M'sieu Laval, what else is wrong?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Everything! ... Madame Colet, if I were your father--  which, fortunately, I am not--

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: And you made any attempt to handle your own business affairs, I would give you a good spanking--in a business way, of course.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: What would you do if you were my <u>secretary</u>?

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: Will you be good enough to run through these papers with M'sieu Giron?

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: What are you going to do with my day tomorrow, M'sieu Laval?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Well, we'll have breakfast in the garden.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: How do you like my dress?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: But you have an engagement, and I don't want people to talk.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: Afraid I'm ruining your reputation, M'sieu Laval?

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: M'sieu Laval, I've got a confession to make to you ...

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: But incidentally, let me tell you, <u>I</u> don't like <u>you</u>. I don't like you at all!  I wouldn't hesitate one instant to ruin <u>your</u> reputation--like that!

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: And you're going to fall for them.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: So you think you can get me?

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: <u>Shut</u> <u>up</u>--<u>kiss</u> <u>me</u>!  Wasting all this marvelous time with arguments!

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: I want you to stay, Mariette. You've <u>got</u> to stay. You can't go now!

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Then why do you want to go?

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: Because I want to make it tough for you.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: When a lady takes her jewels off in a gentleman's room, where does she put them?

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: But I don't want to be a lady.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: Ah, let me have a little fun.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: What would you say if you found your safe had been robbed?

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: I wouldn't say anything--I would act.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: But why talk about robbery on a night like this?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: You have been robbed--for years. And not a hundred thousand francs, but millions. And you know who did it? Adolph.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: And you expect me to believe that?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Naturally not. But I expect the police to believe it.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Why not? He's a thief--he's a criminal.

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Then why are you afraid to let me prove it?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: It would be a terrible scandal, wouldn't it?

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Yes, Giron! Chairman of the board of Colet and Company. Honorary president of the Orphans' Asylum. Adolph J. Giron--distinguished citizen! ... Well, shall I call the police?  I see! You have to be in the social register to keep out of jail. But when a man starts at the bottom and works his way up--a self-made crook --then you say, "Call the police! Put him behind bars! Lock him up!"

turns.speaker: GASTON
turns.text: Wonderful ... But tomorrow morning, if you should wake out of your dreams and hear a knock, and the door opens, and there, instead of a maid with a breakfast tray, stands a policeman with a warrant--then you'll be glad you're alone.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: But it could have been glorious.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE'S VOICE
turns.text: Oh, that's too bad. You see, I wanted her to do something.  Well, I guess I'll have to do it myself.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE'S VOICE
turns.text: I wanted to ask her to ask you if you'd be good enough to go out to dinner with me tonight.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE'S VOICE
turns.text: Oh, no, it's the way you lead.

turns.speaker: GASTON'S VOICE
turns.text: No, madame, it's the way you <u>follow</u>.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE'S VOICE
turns.text: Well, the evening is still young. Let's go down to the living room and talk it over.  It's only ten o'clock.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: But my dear M'sieu Giron, I'm having a tea party. Must I be bothered with all these papers now?

turns.speaker: GIRON
turns.text: I'm sorry, madame, but there are still certain matters which I think you should attend to yourself. And I, personally, would not care to refer them to--to--

turns.speaker: GIRON
turns.text: Madame Colet, I've enjoyed the confidence of your family for more than forty years.  I was a school friend of your husband's ...

turns.speaker: GIRON
turns.text: Madame, let me ask you: Who is M'sieu Laval, anyhow? Where does he come from? What is he?

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: He is my secretary! I hope that answers all your questions, M'sieu Giron.

turns.speaker: GIRON
turns.text: You know what Paris is saying about the Countess Falconier and her chauffeur?

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: You've had your breakfast--oh, but of course you have.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Yes, madame. You see, I have to get up very early.  My little brother goes to school--  You see, Mother is dead.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: Yes, that's the trouble with mothers. First you get to like them and then they die.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: You see--  Oh, not a word to M'sieu Laval!

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: Potatoes. He doesn't want me to eat them--  and naturally I don't want to upset him.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: Now. Uh--mademoiselle--in the short time you have been M'sieu Laval's secretary, have you noticed any change in him?

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: To me he seems rather nervous.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Nervous?  Um-hum. He smokes too much!

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: No, he <u>works</u> too much.  He's chained to his desk. Too much detail. Now, if you could take over some of his work--

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: So he wouldn't be confined so much to his office--

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: Yes! And he would have a little more time for--

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: For all the really important things--

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: I'll do my best, madame, even if I have to work every night.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: Oh, no, no, no, no, my dear child! That's ridiculous. You go home as usual--five o'clock every day. Now I'm going to be a little bit of a tyrant--I insist. It'll be nice for your little brother, too. <u>Five</u> <u>o'clock</u>--remember!

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: Well, in times like these most people are cutting salaries, but suppose we say, in your case, three hundred and fifty?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Oh, madame, you're just too sweet for words!

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Ever had a romance with a crook?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Let me give you a little advice. When you embrace him, be sure to put on your gloves. It would be too bad if your fingerprints were found ...

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: Mademoiselle Gautier--or whatever your name is--I thank you for your advice, but I must ask you to go. You've got your money--

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: You should be ashamed of yourselves. Two men of your standing, always quarreling.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: But you're the more intelligent one.

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: Then why did you do it?

turns.speaker: MAJOR
turns.text: Because I hate him--because I love you!

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: You should have more self-control. You were in the army.

turns.speaker: MAJOR
turns.text: Well, he was in the navy.

turns.speaker: MAJOR
turns.text: Didn't you take it with you?

turns.speaker: MARIETTE
turns.text: Apparently not. Don't you know where it is?

turns.speaker: ANDREWS
turns.text: Water 14 feet above the keel in ten minutes... in the forepeak... in all three holds... and in boiler room six.

turns.speaker: ANDREWS
turns.text: Five compartments. She can stay afloat with the first four compartments breached. But not five. Not five. As she goes down by the head the water will spill over the tops of the bulkheads... at E Deck... from one to the next... back and back. There's no stopping it.

turns.speaker: ANDREWS
turns.text: The pumps buy you time... but minutes only. From this moment, no matter what we do, Titanic will founder.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Your ship is a wonder, Mr. Andrews. Truly.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Mr. Andrews, I did the sum in my head, and with the number of lifeboats times the capacity you mentioned... forgive me, but it seems that there are not enough for everyone aboard.

turns.speaker: ANDREWS
turns.text: About half, actually. Rose, you miss nothing, do you? In fact, I put in these new type davits, which can take an extra row of boats here.  But it was thought... by some... that the deck would look too cluttered. So I was over-ruled.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I saw the iceberg, Mr. Andrews. And I see it in your eyes. Please tell me the truth.

turns.speaker: ANDREWS
turns.text: Yes. In an hour or so... all this... will be at the bottom of the Atlantic.

turns.speaker: ANDREWS
turns.text: Please tell only who you must, I don't want to be responsible for a panic. And get to a boat quickly. Don't wait. You remember what I told you about the boats?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Mr. Andrews, thank God! Where would the Master at Arms take someone under arrest?!

turns.speaker: ANDREWS
turns.text: What? You have to get to a boat right away!

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: No! I'll do this with or without your help, sir. But without will take longer.

turns.speaker: ANDREWS
turns.text: Take the elevator to the very bottom, go left, down the crewman's passage, then make a right.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Bottom, left, right. I have it.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Won't you even make a try for it, Mr. Andrews?

turns.speaker: ANDREWS
turns.text: I'm sorry that I didn't build you a stronger ship, young Rose.
